The ceremony will be live-streamed at tinyurl.com/shslivestream so that anyone that would like to witness it live can do so. It will also be available to watch after the event.

Congratulations again to the Class of 2020!!

Class of 2020 families,

Sparta High School will be hosting our graduation ceremony at 6:30 pm on Thursday, June 25 in our new stadium. Friday, June 26 is our rain date. We appreciate everyone's patience as we have waited for things to open up and allow us to celebrate and provide closure for our graduates. Congratulations again to the Class of 2020!!

This is just a reminder that tomorrow, Tuesday, November 5, is election day for Sparta Area Schools. Our current sinking fund, set to expire at the end of this calendar year, is up for renewal, and we are asking our community to continue to allow us to use this fund for facility renovations and repair. This is NOT a request to increase our current school tax levy. Our sinking fund was first approved by our voters in 2000, and was last renewed in 2010. If approved, our current sinking fund would simply be extended until 2029. Additional information can be found on our website at https://www.spartaschools.org/sinking-fund-information/ and below is the link to a video that was created by a couple of our high school students (they did some great work on it). Please get out and vote, and encourage your friends and neighbors to do the same. Thank you for your support of our schools!!

Sparta Area Schools - Sinking Fund

REQUEST: A 10-year renewal of the district’s existing sinking fund, generating approximately $640,000 annually for facility repairs. A previous request failed in May, but that included an additional levy and items other than repairs. If the proposal is defeated again the current sinking fund will end this year.

COST: The current 1.2373 mills would continue to be assessed, costing the owner of a home valued at $100,000 less than $5 per month ($4.79).

REQUEST: A 10-year renewal of the district’s existing sinking fund, generating approximately $640,000 annually for facility repairs. A previous request failed in May, but that included an additional levy and items other than repairs. If the proposal is defeated again the current sinking fund will end this year.

COST: The current 1.2373 mills would continue to be assessed, costing the owner of a home valued at $100,000 less than $5 per month ($4.79).

DETAILS: https://www.spartaschools.org/sinking-fund-information/

Dear Spartans:

The Kent County Health Department has informed us that the EEE virus (Eastern Equine Encephalitis) has been detected in a deer carcass found in Kent County. No human cases have been identified in Kent County, however, "state health officials are encouraging those in Kent County to postpone, reschedule or cancel outdoor activities happening at or after dusk, particularly any events involving children."

We are in the process of reviewing our evening activities, including tomorrow's homecoming game, and the changes we can make to our schedules so they are done before dusk. There are many logistics involved, but our plan is to make our official decision and notification prior to 10:00 a.m. on Friday morning. We appreciate your patience as we talk to the Health Department and our neighboring schools. We will keep you informed as soon as we have more information to share.

Pete Bush, Superintendent
